title: Consolidated Data Model
description: Consolidated entity schemas from data model files

name.description: Display name of the anomaly or phenomenon (e.g., 'Mercury's Perihelion Precession', 'Ultraviolet Catastrophe')

description.description: Detailed description of the anomaly, what was observed, and why it challenges the theory

theory_id.description: Reference to the theory that this anomaly challenges or violates

violated_assumptions.description: List of assumptions that this anomaly appears to violate or challenge (nested children)

violated_claims.description: Array of claim IDs that this anomaly appears to violate or challenge

discovery_year.description: Year when this anomaly was first observed or discovered

explanation_theory_id.description: Reference to the theory that explains or resolves this anomaly (if applicable)

explanation.description: Description of how the anomaly was explained or resolved, including the explanation year and mechanism. Format: 'Year: [year]. [description]' or just '[description]' if year is in explanation_theory_id's theory year.

papers.description: Array of paper IDs related to this anomaly (discovery papers, explanation papers, etc.)

people.description: Array of person IDs associated with this anomaly (discoverers, explainers, etc.)

statement.description: The assumption statement or description (e.g., 'spacetime is a 4D manifold', 'no external forces act on the system')

rationale.description: Explanation of why this assumption is made, its justification, or the context in which it applies

status.description: Status of the claim: theoretical (not yet tested), verified (confirmed by experiment), falsified (contradicted by evidence), pending_verification (under investigation)

verification_year.description: Year when the claim was verified or falsified (if applicable)

link.description: URL or link to the paper (e.g., Wikipedia article, DOI, etc.)

authors.description: Array of person IDs who authored this paper

nobel_years.description: Array of years when this person received Nobel Prizes

statement.description: The explicitly stated postulate or principle (e.g., 'Equivalence Principle', 'Einstein Field Equations: G_μν = 8πG/c⁴ T_μν')

formulation_year.description: Year when this postulate was formulated (may differ from theory year, as some postulates may predate the full theory)

statement.description: The testable prediction statement (e.g., 'Moving clocks run slower than stationary clocks', 'Light rays are bent by gravitational fields')

prediction_year.description: Year when this prediction was made or published

status.description: Status of the prediction: pending (not yet tested), verified (confirmed by experiment), falsified (contradicted by evidence), partially_verified (some aspects confirmed)

verification_year.description: Year when the prediction was experimentally verified or falsified (if applicable)

verification_method.description: Description of how the prediction was verified or tested (e.g., 'Hafele-Keating experiment with atomic clocks', 'Gravitational lensing observation')

people.description: Array of person_ids who made this prediction or were involved in its verification

papers.description: Array of paper_ids related to this prediction (prediction papers, verification papers, etc.)

name.description: Display name of the prize (e.g., 'Nobel Prize in Physics', 'Kyoto Prize in Basic Sciences')

enum: Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine

description.description: Description of what the prize recognizes

prize_id.description: Reference to the prize being awarded

year.description: Year when the prize was awarded

description.description: Description of why the prize was awarded (e.g., citation text)

people.description: Array of person_ids who received this award

theory_id.description: Reference to theory for which the prize was awarded (if applicable)

explanation.description: Explanation of what this tag represents and how it relates to theories

name.description: Display name of the theory (e.g., 'General Relativity', 'Newton's Laws of Motion')

year.description: Year when the theory was developed or published

summary.description: Brief summary or description of the theory

parent_theory_id.description: Reference to parent theory for hierarchical organization

assumptions.description: List of assumptions underlying this theory (nested children)

postulates.description: List of fundamental postulates of this theory (nested children)

claims.description: List of claims or consequences made by this theory (nested children)

predictions.description: List of testable predictions made by this theory (nested children)

anomalies.description: Array of anomaly IDs that challenge or are explained by this theory

papers.description: Array of paper IDs referencing key papers related to this theory

people.description: Array of person IDs referencing people associated with this theory

tags.description: Array of tag IDs for categorizing and searching theories

nobel_year.description: Year when a Nobel Prize was awarded for this theory (if applicable)

violated_assumption_id.description: Unique identifier for this violated assumption record

assumption_id.description: Reference to the assumption from the theory that is being violated

violation_description.description: Description of how this specific assumption is violated by the anomaly
